Package com.norconex.collector.http.fetch.util

Interface IRedirectURLProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericRedirectURLProvider
    public interface IRedirectURLProvider
    Responsible for providing a target absolute URL each time an HTTP redirect is encountered when invoking a URL. Target URLs are treated as new URLs to process, while the original URL gets rejected. Sometimes redirect URLs returned with the HTTP headers are relatives, have bad encoding, etc. Implementors are free to handle/fix these conditions as they see fit.
    Since:
    2.4.0
    Author:
    Pascal Essiembre

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      String provideRedirectURL​(org.apache.http.HttpRequest request, org.apache.http.HttpResponse response, org.apache.http.protocol.HttpContext context)
      Provides the redirect URL that the crawler must follow.

    • Method Detail

      • provideRedirectURL

        String provideRedirectURL​(org.apache.http.HttpRequest request,
                          org.apache.http.HttpResponse response,
                          org.apache.http.protocol.HttpContext context)
        Provides the redirect URL that the crawler must follow. This method is only invoked when a redirect has been detected. As such, it should rarely return null. Returning null effectively prevents a redirect from happening, but it is an efficient way to disable redirects. The recommended approach to disable redirects is to set zero on GenericHttpFetcherConfig.setMaxRedirects(int)
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP request that led to the redirect
        response - original URL HTTP response
        context - execution state of an HTTP process
        Returns:
        redirect URL
